name: Kodak Brownie SIX-20 D Box Camera with Satchel 1946-57
description: Beautiful Kodak box brownie camera from about 1946-1957. Everything on the camera is in working order, the shutter release works fine, both the portrait and landscape viewfinders are clean and clear and the film winder seems in working order, all in all the camera is in perfect condition like it never left the showroom! It comes with a nice brown satchel case.

name: Kodak Brownie Flash B Camera 1958-60 With Original Carry Bag
description: A high grade Box camera made by Kodak Limited London. *Item will also be listed on ebay The 620(Six-20) film can be used and takes 8 exposures of 6×9cm size. The lens is a single cell but another lens can be added inside the camera by pulling the side lever for closed shot. Aperture is about F11. It has three speeds of shutter, which are B,1/40 and 1/80sec. There are two reflex view finders on the box, one is on the top and the other is on the side of body. It is very clear view finders that it is able to see clearly even in bright field. Film winding is the type of a red window. There is another side lever on the side, which can be added Y2 filter to rear of the lens. The flush unit can be attached with a single screw and has a hot synchronized without code. The shutter speed should be used in 1/40sec when you use the flush gun. This Camera is once again in perfect condition, everything seems in working order although i haven’t had a chance to develop the Roll Film i had in it yet!
